data.approach: Reviewing uncommitted changes that fix overflow issues in TaskDetailPaneA and related components. Build passes. Need to verify the fix is complete and commit.

data.taskTitle: fix EpicSwarmModal to show epics with 0 ready tasks
summary: Fixed Epic Swarm modal to show all open epics, including those with no ready tasks
Removed filter that was excluding epics with ready=0
Added visual indicator in dropdown for epics with no ready tasks
Added warning alert explaining why tasks cannot be launched when epic has 0 ready tasks

changes.description: Removed ready>0 filter, added dropdown indicator, added warning alert with context

data.taskTitle: user is on /tasks2 and sees steelbridge-b2y and presses alt-e for epic swarm but says no epics found
data.approach: The issue is that EpicSwarmModal filters out closed epics. steelbridge-b2y is an epic with status=closed but has open children. Need to modify the filtering logic to include closed epics that still have open children, or epics from external projects like steelbridge.

data.taskTitle: user is on /tasks2 and sees steelbridge-b2y and presses alt-e for epic swarm but says no epics found
user is on /tasks2 and sees steelbridge-b2y and presses alt-e for epic swarm but says no epics found
data.approach: Fixed two issues: 1) EpicSwarmModal now detects virtual epics from hierarchical task IDs, 2) epicQueueStore now uses /api/work/spawn for correct cross-project spawning

data.taskTitle: user is on /tasks2 and sees steelbridge-b2y and presses alt-e for epic swarm but says no epics found
summary: Fixed EpicSwarmModal to detect virtual epics from hierarchical task IDs (steelbridge-b2y.1 -> steelbridge-b2y)
Fixed epicQueueStore to use /api/work/spawn instead of /api/sessions for correct cross-project spawning
The old endpoint defaulted to IDE cwd which was wrong for cross-project tasks like steelbridge
reviewFocus: Test Epic Swarm on steelbridge-b2y again to verify spawns work correctly

suggestedTasks.title: Debug Epic Retrieval Logic in Tasks Page
suggestedTasks.description: Investigate why open epics are not being detected on /tasks2 route. Examine the filtering and data fetching mechanism in the Svelte component. Verify API calls, data transformation, and state management related to epic display. Potential areas to check include query parameters, state initialization, and data filtering logic.
suggestedTasks.reason: Current implementation fails to display expected open epics

suggestedTasks.title: Add Comprehensive Epic Retrieval Unit Tests
suggestedTasks.description: Create comprehensive unit tests for epic retrieval functionality. Cover scenarios including empty lists, partial results, and different filtering conditions. Implement tests in the tasks route component to ensure reliable epic detection across various data states.
suggestedTasks.reason: Lack of test coverage exposed current detection issues

gotchas: Epic retrieval logic may have hidden complexity

documentationNeeds: Update troubleshooting guide for epic display issues
